author: bolaji
title: DAOs for Creative communities
description: 非洲的创意社区高度受制于造假、金融服务不足和缺乏艺术品的来源。

f6_assessments.q0: 该提案所能产生的社会经济和全球影响是巨大的。关于埃塞俄比亚的创意社区没有足够的支持的问题声明，建议通过提供一个Cardano DAO来帮助这些社区来解决。该团队制定了一系列的计划，以提高当地人对Cardano生态系统的适应性。在成功完成该提案后，可以预期Cardano网络将有更多的流量流入，并有更多来自非洲社区的贡献。这可以帮助Cardano在整个非洲大陆打响知名度。然而，这个令人钦佩的提案所遗漏的地方是，该团队没有提到DAO如何填补当前金融服务留下的空白，以及如何使DAO更加可信和值得信赖。总的来说，该提案似乎很有前途，我将把其影响评为4分（满分5分）。
f6_assessments.q1: 该团队对其提出的计划给予了高度评价，但没有提到使这一建议获得成功所需的团队及其经验。尽管申请了大约20万的资金（占分配金额的2/5），但没有明确的迹象表明资金将如何被利用。同样，该提案有一个耐人寻味的目标，即在非洲国家增加Cardano的使用，但并没有向读者提供他们的行动计划和团队计划实现的里程碑，以及在什么时间范围内。如果该团队能够向社区提供他们的游戏计划，其中还包括该团队预计可能面临的挑战和缺点，以及他们找到跨越这些挑战的策略，可以使这个提案成为社区的一个亮点。在提到上述几点后，尽管该提案是一个有影响力的提案，但根据手头的信息，很难得出它能取得多大成功的结论。
f6_assessments.q2: 通过作者提出的指标和结果，我们可以看到新加入网络的人有了相当大的增加。但是，提案中没有提供关键绩效指标来了解这个项目，特别是在其中发挥了多大的作用。没有制定好的里程碑供审计人员跟踪进展，也没有衡量资金的及时利用和投资回报的标准。适度的努力，为审计人员提供一些可信的数字，将使提案更加实用和易于理解。该团队也没有提到其成员，以便社区根据以前对生态系统的贡献来预测这个项目的结果。总而言之，一个精心设计的游戏计划可能会使这个提案成为Cardano社区的明显赢家。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is misaligned with the goals of the challenge. The Challenge is focused growing the DAO communities through tooling or infrastructure development in order to improve Cardano's competitiveness for deploying new DAOs. Although the proposal aims grow the DAO communities by on boarding creative African DAOs through local training, marketing, and incentives. It does not offer a solution to improve the fundamental DAO  experience or make Cardano a better alternative to other blockchains. For these reasons, I do not believe this proposal address the challenge goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal request 40% of the challenge budget and does not offer a reasonable metric to measure the progress and success of the project other than an increase in all transactions from the African continent. It will be difficult to measure the success of the project and even more difficult determine if the project is implemented successfully. Although the proposer's experience with the Nigerian Stock Exchange does inspire confidence that the proposer has the technical skills to successfully implement the project.
f6_assessments.q2: Minimal information is provided to audit and track the progress of the proposal. The Proposal does not provide a timeline or expected date for a public launch. This will make it difficult to maintain transparency with the community. The proposal does not offer breakdown of the budget in effort to justify requesting 40% of the challenge funds or enable to community to track how funds will be used. The proposer is not include any identifying information which diminishes the trust from the community that the proposer can be held accountable for the success and failures of the project. For these reasons it will be very difficult to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement reads "Creative communities in Africa are highly subjected to counterfeiting, inadequate financial services and lack of provenance of art."  A Cardano DAO is presented as the solution.  Tooling and infrastructure to build DAOs on Cardano is limited at the moment, and the proposer intends to solve three wicked problems by creating a DAO.  These are important problems to solve, but there is a gap in how the DAO will be created and once created, how can we be sure that the DAO will have to the ability to solve the stated problems.
f6_assessments.q1: As someone with experience in creating startups and working with DAOs, it seems that this proposal might be overly ambitious in relation to the amount of detail provided.  I would feel more comfortable giving a higher score if the scope was smaller with more detail.   The proposer states "An ethereum fractional investment NFT platform and blockchain solution for Nigerian Stock Exchange and Customs Excise Trade respectively" as experience.  This is impressive, but there is no way for voters to verify.  The github link that was shared contained Solidity contracts.  It was unclear to me if this link represents part of the DAO being proposed, or part of the fractional investment platform that was mentioned.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposer is asking for 200K with no KPIs or detailed roadmap.  I would also like to see if any risks had been considered, and if so, how would they be mitigated.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to create a DAO for creative communities (with focus on Africa). The proposer offers a rough explanation of the proposes solution. However, it doesn't clearly outline how the idea will be turned into reality. It's more an idea than an executable plan or project. Of course, the Cardano ecosystem will have an advantage of a successful DAOs for communities. But there is many information missing, why this proposal will success and how it will succeed. I rate Impact with 2 starts because the impact remains vague but at least he idea in general is good and important.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer provides no step-by-step plan for the development with clear milestones and a defined time horizon. Also an explanation of the budget is not provided and therefore I cannot say whether it is appropriate or not. The proposal doesn't offer a realistic timetable to complete the work. The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful adoption. Also there is no reference or link to previous projects of the proposer linked. So I have not enough information whether this proposal is feasible or not.
f6_assessments.q2: It will be hard to track the progress and success of this project as no launch date or roadmap with milestones has been provided. No key performance indicators as well. What I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them (e.g. difficulties in adoption). The proposer has a Github repository, but it is not clearly mentioned if the community can audit the progress of the proposal there.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal speaks directly to the main objectives of the challenge, by creating DAOs for Creative communities to solve counterfeiting, inadequate financial services and lack of provenance of art in Africa. Should this project is successfully delivered, it can have big impact in cardano publicity and could drive massive adoption in other countries or regions. The project can also be replicated to solve other issue related to decentralized voting and verification. It has huge potential to be a game changer in blockchain adoption and implementation.
f6_assessments.q1: The team does mention relevant experience in the proposal but it lacks the evidences to back up the claim. In my opinion, it is hard for community to ensure the continuation and success of this project. The team requested a relatively high budget without detail on how the money will be spend or allocated. It is surprising this proposal is pass for assessment given there is no roadmap, budget breakdown, or timeline for the execution of this project in the proposal. The detailed plan provided does not give the detail plan (I know it is confusing but it is what it is). My suggestion for the team is to update the proposal with more information and details.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no clear success metrics or KPI in the proposal. The team does not provide deliverables, roadmap, or detailed plan on how to execute the project and there is no budget breakdown in the proposal. Team does not mention where they will publish the progress of project execution making it impossible to trace, monitor, or audit the project. My suggestion for the team is to update the proposal with more information and details including deliverables, goals, KPI, roadmap, detailed execution plan, and budget breakdown.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great idea for Africa and the African market. Proposer highlighted the problem present in the Africa and offered an excellent solution. If this idea were to be realized, it would have a great positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. In the proposal we can see through the description of the idea what value this idea would give to the Cardano ecosystem. It would be good if the proposer listed and elaborated the KPIs. As KPIs are missing it is difficult to compare KPIs with challenge setting. The proposal is not able to scale and address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: There is a video link in the proposal that explains the whole idea and maybe we can conclude what experience and skill sets will be necessary to deliver on the proposal. In the video there is also a link to the website of the project holder but unfortunately we do not have clear information on how many people will work on this project and whether the individual or team has the necessary skills, knowledge and experience to implement the proposal. Maybe it would be good to introduce themselves to the community via LinkedIn. The budget is hugely disproportionate and not broken down into identifiable items. We do not have a clear insight into what exactly the money will be spent on. Such a great idea for the African market should have an elaborated plan, actionable tasks and order of execution, realistic timetable to complete the work, technical aspects, necessary resources and an elaborated idea of possible risks.
f6_assessments.q2: It would be great for an idea like this that would definitely help people in Africa and expand the Cardano ecosystem to develop a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement and to develop and list KPIs. It is absolutely impossible for the community to track the progress of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge brief calls for tooling and infrastructure developed on the cardano ecosystem and Not actually the implementation of a DAO and therefore whilst the idea behind this DAO holds value it is misplaced within the challenge. It would be great to see some form of tooling implementation.
f6_assessments.q1: Whilst a github is provided. The scope and skills of the team are not and so it is impossible to determine the required skills are available to implement such a large project. There needs to be a clear breakdown of costs and how these funds will be distributed for such a large number.
f6_assessments.q2: No clear roadmap or KPIs have been provided and so it is impossible to audit the success of the project. The problem however is clearly stated and a solution is provided but it would be great to delve deeper into the actual implementation of that solution.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement is clear and meaningful -fight counterfeiting, better financing of african art communities.
However, the proposal does not provide details on how a DAO can be a solution to this problem. Therefore, I disagree that this proposal correctly addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Low details are given on what will be the DAO and how it will set up. The team has experience inf Ethereum smartcontracts, and provide a github with an auction smart contract (whose I'm not able to assess the quality). However no Haskell / Plutus experience is claimed.
The proposal does not include details on what are project milestones and risks.
For this reasons I strongly disagree that this team has this project will be implemented sucessfuly.
f6_assessments.q2: Considering the high amount requested (200k$) and the fact that the proposal does not include any roadmap or key metrics for the project development, I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess its progress.

f6_assessments.q0: I will start with a qualitative comment in the hopes it removes the sting of a proposal I wanted to rate more highly.  It seems that the request amount may just be out of scale with what I would want to see for a proposal that doesn't seem to be paired with clear implementation goals.  The key metrics for the campaign include two technical metrics (increasing DAO transaction fees and building toolsets), and one social or influence metric that would apply: increasing the number of DAOs that use Cardano.  But that metric is short term, only six months, and it doesn't seem that an influence campaign as described here fits that timeframe well.  Perhaps this is just needs to be in a different campaign?  This is my first time as an Assessor, so take it with a grain of salt.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the plan, as described, could be very successful in education and encouragement if carried out on that scale.  But it seems to me to have a fairly wide purview, and my personal preference for this type of funding would be more narrowly defined.
f6_assessments.q2: I wonder if this type of qualitative assessment could be easily measured, and if so, how directly it could be attributed to this effort specifically.

solution: Cardano DAO可以促进减少造假，更好的艺术品出处，并为非洲艺术社区提供defi服务。
experience: 以太坊零散投资NFT平台和区块链解决方案，分别用于尼日利亚证券交易所和海关税收贸易。
